availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Beatty (Owlsey County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and sgt, 1st lieut, capt 7th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and soldier. Missouri native. Schoolteacher in Owsley County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant, first lieutenant, and captain from September 22, 1861, to September 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Beatyville, p. 377.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport â€“ Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7016180, All County Deaths, p. 1139.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0210.
Find A Grave, "James Madison Beatty (1836-1915)," Memorial #38386623, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/38386623 (accessed September 15, 2020).
